metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9555 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sctp_sf_ootb function in net/sctp/sm_statefuns.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.8 lacks chunk-length checking for the first chunk, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds slab access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted SCTP data. Andrey Konovalov discovered that the SCTP implementation in the Linux kernel improperly handled validation of incoming data. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-57-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-lowlatency - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-4.4.0-57-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-57-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.46').
